bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, June 26, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: 5 Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, June 26, 1891

p.add: Approval of Nelson sent to Yates Bros Shattuck & c 89 State Street Naston Mass.

div1.p: Mr Beverly Y. Payne to the Department of State
Subject: Transmitting the deposition of Frank Nelson at Elmina
5 Consulate General of the United States. Monrovia, Liberia, June 26, 1891
Hon., William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State Washington, D. C.

Sir: Referring to Mr Clark's No 13. of April 9, I have the honor most respectfully to transmit herewith, the deposition of Frank Nelson, taken by the Consular Agent at Elmina, September 5, 1890, which has just reached this Consulate.
I have the honor to be, Sir: Your obedient Servant
Beverly Y. Payne U.S. Vice Consul General
